Software License Agreement
==========================

| Copyright (C) 2024-2025 ATTMOS Inc.
| All Rights Reserved.

| 1. Scope of Use
| This software and its associated documentation files (the "Software"), are permitted for use by researchers in pharmaceutical and biotech companies, consultants, independent contractors, and academic researchers (the ”User”) for the purposes of reparameterizing force fields and using them in computational drug discovery. Use outside of these specified purposes, including but not limited to other industries or user types, without express written permission from ATTMOS Inc. is strictly prohibited.

| 2. Intellectual Property Rights
| ATTMOS Inc. retains all rights, title, and interest in the algorithm behind the force field development platform. All third-party dependencies included in the Software and listed in “Third Party Disclaimer” section below are subject to their respective licenses. The User must comply with these licenses and acknowledge that ATTMOS Inc. claims no ownership over these third-party components.

| 3. Warranties and Disclaimers
| THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, AND NONINFRINGEMENT. In no event shall ATTMOS Inc. be liable for any claim, damages, or other liability, whether in an action of contract, tort, or otherwise, arising from, out of, or in connection with the Software or the use or other dealings in the Software.

| 4. Academic Research Use
| This license allows for the use of the Software for non-commercial academic research purposes. The User agrees to cite the platform in all publications resulting from such use. The User further agrees to promptly publish the results of any research conducted using the Software, acknowledging the use of the platform in such publications.

| 5. Software Package Components
| The Software provided under this license consists of a shared object library and a Jupyter Notebook that utilizes said library (collectively referred to as the "Package"). The User is granted access to the Package in its compiled form only. Source code is not provided under this license, and the User is not authorized to reverse engineer, decompile, disassemble, or otherwise attempt to derive the source code of the Software, except to the extent that such activity is expressly permitted by applicable law notwithstanding this limitation.

| 6. Usage Rights
| The User is granted a non-exclusive, non-transferable, limited right to use the Package for educational, research, and non-profit purposes as defined under the "Scope of Use" section of this agreement. Any use of the Package outside of these defined purposes requires a separate written agreement with ATTMOS Inc.

| 7. Termination
| This license is effective until terminated. ATTMOS Inc. reserves the right to terminate this license at any time if the User is found to be in violation of any terms and conditions herein. Upon termination, the User must cease all use of the Software and destroy all copies, full or partial, of the Software.

| **Third Party Disclaimer**
| Portions of this Software utilize free third party software distributed under different licenses. These include `AmberTools <https://ambermd.org/index.php>`_, `QUICK <https://github.com/merzlab/QUICK>`_, `XTB <https://github.com/grimme-lab/xtb>`_, `geomeTRIC <https://github.com/leeping/geomeTRIC>`_ , `jupyterlab <https://jupyter.org/>`_, `jupyter-notebook <https://jupyter.org/>`_, `py3dmol <https://pypi.org/project/py3Dmol/>`_, `ipywidgets <https://pypi.org/project/ipywidgets/>`_, `OpenCV <https://pypi.org/project/opencv-python/>`_, `Rdkit <https://www.rdkit.org/>`_, `fortranformat <https://pypi.org/project/fortranformat/>`_, `tornado <https://pypi.org/project/tornado/>`_, `matplotlib <https://pypi.org/project/matplotlib/>`_, `numpy <https://numpy.org/>`_, `pandas <https://pypi.org/project/pandas/>`_, `SciPy <https://scipy.org/>`_, and `ASE <https://wiki.fysik.dtu.dk/ase/>`_.

| For inquiries regarding commercial use, or any other questions related to this license, please contact:
